Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray:
Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray_leaf_spot 
 - spray with Priaxor /Headline / Quilt Xcel
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_:
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_ 
  - use protectant fungicide like chlorothalonil and mancozeb, and use of resistant maize varieties
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight:
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight 
 - spray plants with fungicides containing mancozeb, picoxystrobin and azoxystrobin
Tomato___Bacterial_spot:
Tomato___Bacterial_spot 
 - use mancozeb with bactericides and apply copper antibacterial agent every 10 -14 days for control
Tomato___Early_blight:
Tomato___Early_blight 
 - use fungicides to spray, recommended fungicides are : azoxitrobin, pyraclostrobin, difenconazole, bonkalid, phenamidone
Tomato___Late_blight:
Tomato___Late_blight 
 - destroy infected crop,Spray fungicides of mandipropamid, chlorothalonil, yazinum, and mancozeb
Tomato___Leaf_Mold:
Tomato___Leaf_Mold 
 - fungicides spray before infection (chlorothalon11, maneb), copper fungicide ( difenoconazole) for fields
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot:
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot 
 - spray with copper based fungicides ( copper hydroxide, copper sulphate) to control disease
Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider:
Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider_mite 
  - use biopesticides (Bacillus thuringiensius), spray with garlic tea
Tomato___Target_Spot:
Tomato___Target_Spot 
 - apply mulch or vine at base of plant, water plants in the morning using horse or drip system
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus:
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus 
 - control breeding of whiteflies to avoid disease (spray with eco-oil 3 days)
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus:
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus 
 - seed treatment only available, soak seeds in trisodium phosphate solution, 15 minutes and dry
